reg:regulation.reg:acttitle: Farming and Fishing Industries Development Act
reg:regulation.reg:title: Dairy Industry Development Council Regulation
reg:regulation.reg:amsincluded: [includes amendments up to B.C. Reg. 61/2005, February 25, 2005]

bcl:definition.bcl:text: Act means the Farming and Fishing Industries Development Act;
council means the Dairy Industry Development Council established by the minister under section 2 of the Act;
levy means the levy in section 4 of the Act and section 2 of this regulation;
milk means milk or cream obtained from cows;
processor means a person who operates a dairy plant and receives or uses milk for processing into a dairy product;
producer means a person who produces milk.

bcl:section.bcl:text: Every producer must pay to the council the levy established by the council under section 4 (1) of the Act.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: The board must collect the levy on behalf of the council by deducting it from the proceeds otherwise due to a producer for milk delivered.
The levy is payable on the last day of the month for which the levy is collected.
On or before the 30th day of the month following the month for which the levy was collected, the board must remit to the council the amount collected by the board for the previous month.

reg:content.reg:provisionsnote: [Provisions of the Farming and Fishing Industries Development Act, R.S.B.C. 1996, c. 134, relevant to the enactment of this regulation: sections 4 and 10]
